title: Evaporative Canister - Installation

body.body: Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
If disconnected, reconnect the air and drain hoses to the left hand side of the evaporative cannister in the position and orientation noted during removal.
Refit the evaporative cannister to the battery tray, routing the air and drain hoses as noted during removal. Position the drain hose into its locating feature on the battery tray.
Ensure that the ends of the air and drain hoses are passed through the opening in the battery tray.

body.name: EVAP air and drain hose routing, L0324

body.body: Reconnect the fuel tank and purge valve hoses to the right hand side of the cannister in the positions noted during removal.
